abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings show a satisfactory project
            outcome, highly likely sustainability, and high
            institutional development impacts. Lessons suggest the
            following success factors. The groundwork established by the
            Energy Sector Management Programme (ESMAP), and the Public
            Sector Reform Loan, supported this project's
            objectives, implemented largely in parallel with the Energy
            Sector Technical Assistance Loan. However, the extensive
            preparation work, which included a relatively large number
            of missions, was also instrumental in the identification of
            those elements of reform which required greatest support,
            and whose outcome will likely have the most lasting impact.
            Moreover, the carefully planned core of responsibilities by
            Interconexion Electrica S.A. (ISA) in the management of the
            wholesale market, its Third Transmission Plan, as well as
            its own development plan, contributed to the strong
            ownership response, demonstrated throughout implementation.
            Despite successes, shortcomings included the attacks to the
            transmission infrastructure, a risk not identified during
            preparation, which had disruptive effects on the
            transmission system. Thus, recognition of the possibility of
            politically-induced terrorism on infrastructure projects,
            should be introduced into the appraisal process. In
            addition, the use of funds, e.g., for technical assistance,
            constitutes an important lending element, and should be
            recognized during the negotiation process.
